intro: Benzoin hypoglaucum, commonly known as the lesser benzoin, is a small, evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant produces a fragrant resin that can be tapped from its bark, similar to other members of its family. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-yellow in color, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits.
